answers.answer: Hi,How are you? Numbness in the extremities usually suggests neurological or vascular causes. You can opt to for the symptoms to settle spontaneously, as they often will. However if they do persist, have this checked by your doctor for proper evaluation. Unfortunately, X-rays are frequently unhelpful because they only show bony changes while an MRI scan is much more useful in identifying causes of pressure on the nerve. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: For the last 3 weeks the top of my left foots been numb.like its fallen asleep and not woken up.It seems to be moving up my leg in the front.I cant feel any in a spot 3x3 on the bottom by ankle.No injuries that im aware of.no diabetes or any other health problems that would cause this.Ive tried icing it and using heat,rubbing it,propping it up often,i dont cross my legs..or sit on them,and im pretty active moving around.Nothing relives it..it stays numb no matter what i try.Im also fairly young...i just turned 31.Should i be concerned?And try to get in to see a doctor?
title: Foot numb
